title: Walter Munk
summary: Walter Heinrich Munk (October 19, 1917 â€“ February 8, 2019)[1] was an American physical oceanographer.[1][7] One of the first scientists to bring statistical methods to the analysis of oceanographic data, Munk is noted for creating fruitful areas of research that continue to be explored by other scientists. Munk's work garnered him many prestigious awards including the National Medal of Science, the Kyoto Prize, and induction to the French Legion of Honour.
